title: Mars Habitat Design Challenge
description: Design a sustainable habitat for Mars colonization that can support 50 people for 2 years.
problemStatement:
Create a comprehensive design for a Mars habitat that addresses:

1. Life Support Systems
- Oxygen generation and CO2 scrubbing
- Water recycling (99% efficiency target)
- Waste management
- Temperature regulation (-63Â°C to 20Â°C)

2. Radiation Protection
- Shield against cosmic rays and solar radiation
- Safe exposure limits (<100 mSv/year)
- Emergency shelter protocols

3. Food Production
- Hydroponic/aeroponic systems
- Nutritional requirements for 50 people
- 70% food self-sufficiency minimum

4. Energy Systems
- Solar panel arrays with battery storage
- Backup nuclear power options
- Energy efficiency optimization

5. Psychological Well-being
- Recreation areas
- Privacy considerations
- Communication with Earth

Deliverables:
- 3D CAD models
- Engineering calculations
- Resource requirements
- Risk assessment
- Budget projection

title: AI Exoplanet Detection Algorithm
description: Develop a machine learning model to detect exoplanets from stellar light curves with >95% accuracy.
problemStatement:
Build an AI system to identify exoplanets using the transit method:

1. Dataset Analysis
- Kepler Space Telescope light curve data
- 100,000+ stellar observations
- Labeled true positives and false positives

2. Model Requirements
- Precision: >95%
- Recall: >90%
- Processing: <100ms per light curve
- Explain ability for scientific validation

3. Features to Detect
- Transit depth and duration
- Period consistency
- Secondary eclipses
- Multiple planet systems

4. Challenges
- Noise and stellar variability
- Rare positive examples (class imbalance)
- Different star types and sizes
- Instrumental artifacts

5. Innovation Areas
- Novel feature engineering
- Attention mechanisms
- Transfer learning approaches
- Real-time classification

Deliverables:
- Trained model with source code
- Performance metrics and validation
- Research paper draft
- API for integration

title: Space Debris Tracking System
description: Create a real-time space debris tracking and collision prediction system for satellite operators.
problemStatement:
Develop a system to track and predict space debris trajectories:

1. Data Sources
- Two-Line Element (TLE) sets from Space-Track.org
- Radar observations
- Telescope tracking data
- 30,000+ tracked objects

2. Core Features
- Real-time position calculation
- Orbital propagation (SGP4/SDP4)
- Collision probability assessment
- Alert system for close approaches

3. Visualization
- 3D Earth orbit display
- Debris density heat maps
- Conjunction warnings
- Historical pass predictions

4. Performance Targets
- Update rate: 1 minute
- Prediction accuracy: <1km at 24 hours
- Alert threshold: <5km proximity
- Support 1000+ simultaneous users

5. User Interface
- Satellite operator dashboard
- Mobile app for alerts
- API for third-party integration
- Historical event playback

Deliverables:
- Web application
- Mobile app
- API documentation
- User guide

title: Autonomous Lunar Rover Navigation
description: Program an autonomous navigation system for a lunar rover to navigate hazardous terrain.
problemStatement:
Create autonomous navigation software for lunar exploration:

1. Environment Challenges
- Extreme temperature variations
- Limited communication (2.6 second delay)
- Crater and boulder obstacles
- Fine dust and traction issues

2. Navigation Requirements
- Autonomous obstacle avoidance
- Path planning and optimization
- Hazard detection (slopes >30Â°, rocks >50cm)
- Energy-efficient routing

3. Sensing and Perception
- Stereo camera processing
- LIDAR point cloud analysis
- IMU integration
- Terrain classification

4. Control Systems
- Wheel slip compensation
- Stability monitoring
- Emergency stop protocols
- Battery management

5. Simulation Testing
- Unity/Gazebo environment
- Realistic lunar physics
- 10km+ navigation scenarios
- Recovery from failures

Deliverables:
- Simulation environment
- Navigation algorithms
- Performance analysis
- Video demonstrations

title: Solar Storm Prediction Model
description: Build a predictive model for solar storms and their impact on Earth's magnetosphere.
problemStatement:
Develop a forecasting system for space weather events:

1. Data Integration
- Solar wind measurements (ACE satellite)
- Magnetometer data (ground stations)
- X-ray flux (GOES satellites)
- Coronal mass ejection (CME) imagery

2. Prediction Targets
- Geomagnetic storm intensity (Kp index)
- Aurora visibility forecasts
- Satellite communication disruptions
- GPS accuracy degradation

3. Time Horizons
- Short-term: 1-6 hours ahead
- Medium-term: 1-3 days ahead
- Alert triggers and confidence levels

4. Model Performance
- Accuracy: >80% for major storms
- False alarm rate: <20%
- Lead time: 6+ hours for warnings

5. Visualization & Alerts
- Global aurora forecast maps
- Storm progression timeline
- Impact severity indicators
- Automated notifications

Deliverables:
- Prediction model and code
- Dashboard interface
- Validation report
- Integration API

title: Asteroid Mining Economics Simulator
description: Create a simulation game that models the economics and logistics of asteroid mining operations.
problemStatement:
Build an educational simulation for asteroid mining:

1. Game Mechanics
- Select target asteroids (NEAs database)
- Plan mission trajectories
- Allocate resources and equipment
- Manage extraction operations

2. Economic Model
- Launch costs ($10,000/kg to LEO)
- Mining equipment expenses
- Precious metal prices (platinum, gold, rare earths)
- Market dynamics and demand

3. Technical Constraints
- Delta-v requirements
- Mission duration (2-5 years typical)
- Equipment reliability
- Communication delays

4. Resource Management
- Budget allocation
- Fuel and supplies
- Crew (if applicable)
- Risk vs. reward decisions

5. Educational Value
- Real orbital mechanics
- Accurate cost estimates
- Scientific asteroid data
- Tutorial and explanations

Deliverables:
- Playable web game
- Source code
- Design document
- Educational guide

title: ISS Tracking & Educational Platform
description: Design an interactive platform to track the International Space Station and educate users about space stations.
problemStatement:
Create an engaging educational platform:

1. Core Features
- Real-time ISS position tracking
- Ground track visualization
- Viewing opportunity calculator
- Crew information and activities

2. Educational Content
- Station modules and components
- Scientific experiments onboard
- Life in microgravity
- Space station history

3. Interactive Elements
- Virtual station tour (3D)
- Quizzes and achievements
- Live video feed integration
- Astronaut Q&A archives

4. Notification System
- Visible pass alerts by location
- Docking/undocking events
- Spacewalk schedules
- Research highlights

5. Accessibility
- Mobile responsive design
- Multiple languages
- Screen reader compatible
- Offline mode for core features

Deliverables:
- Web application
- Mobile app (iOS/Android)
- Content management system
- Analytics dashboard

title: Launch Window Optimization Algorithm
description: Develop an algorithm to calculate optimal rocket launch windows considering multiple constraints.
problemStatement:
Create a launch window calculator:

1. Input Parameters
- Launch site coordinates
- Target orbit (LEO, GTO, etc.)
- Payload mass and dimensions
- Mission constraints

2. Optimization Factors
- Orbital mechanics (Hohmann transfers)
- Weather conditions
- Range safety requirements
- Fuel efficiency

3. Constraints
- Launch site availability
- Ground station coverage
- Lighting conditions (for recovery)
- Collision avoidance with existing satellites

4. Output Requirements
- Multiple launch windows (primary, backup)
- Trajectory profiles
- Delta-v calculations
- Success probability estimates

5. Visualization
- Ground track maps
- Orbital insertion diagrams
- Weather forecast integration
- Timeline charts

Deliverables:
- Calculation engine
- Web interface
- API documentation
- Validation against real launches
